page.title: 01THE SCREDINGTON AREA.
page.content: In the block being surveyed there are two villages called Northbeck and Scredington.Scredington being the larger.Most of the houses are in the villages, 26 of these being council owned. There are 6 farms in the outlying area.The total population numbers approximately 300 people. The land is flat with small groups of trees and it rises slightly to the east . All of the land is cultivated. Growing crops like oilseed rape, wheat ,barley and mustard . Between the two villages are three moats in fields where sheep graze . Running from west to east is a stream called Northbeck and in the village of Northbeck there is an old pack _horse bridge. Electric pylons stretch from north to south of the area . The nearest town is sleaford four miles away .
